cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west, forecast to turn west-northwest toward the northern Leeward Islands, Bahamas, and eventually the Florida peninsula before lifting toward the Southeast U.S. coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Florida or the Florida Keys (first U.S. landfall)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches currently limited to parts of the Dominican Republic, Haiti, Turks and Caicos, and the southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings in effect for the northern Leeward Islands, U.S. and British Virgin Islands, and Puerto Rico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, northern coast of Hispaniola, Turks & Caicos, Bahamas, and eventually Florida peninsula
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) possible late Sun–Mon if Irma tracks close enough to the Georgia coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Depending on the exact track, surge of 3–5 ft above normal tides is possible along the Georgia coast early next week.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 4–6 inches of rain with localized higher amounts, producing flooding in low-lying areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning this weekend ahead of Irma’s approach.
